Articles.Content:
Hello all! Many people have talked about the weird heat shields and pods flipping over. I have created a ModuleManager patch that fixes this. The Heat Shields are set to be physicsless by default, and even though KSP now adds their mass to the root part, it doesn't shift the COM. So, by disabling the "physicsless" flag, they should move the COM and act properly during reentry. I haven't personally been able to test this yet, so, even though my name would imply otherwise, I need you guys to test it. Tell me how it goes!

Installation:

KSP 1.0.1 fixes this itself. I appreciate the 1,200+ downloads, but this mod is no longer required. Links removed.

Safe flying.![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Released under [MIT license](http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).

Besides, this is a good start for me.

> 
> Besides, this is a good start for me.

Looking for any help in the future?

I have coding experience...
This was just a good first step. I want to start making parts mods with MM rebalancing for all parts, even taking in other parts packs, but any help will be appreciated.
While I haven't had the chance to test this patch specifically, I can confirm that editing to change "PhysicsSignificance = 1" to 0 fixes the wonkyness and pods fly nice and straight again.
That's exactly what I did, but I just put it as a ModuleManager config so it's installed just like any other mod.
Has anyone confirmed that it works for them?

With the release of 1.0.1, this mod is obsolete. This thread will be deleted.

Anyways, so long, and thanks for all the fish.
